item.title: Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.6.8 Release Candidate - Testers Wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
mT8RQf:

ok I’d be happy to, but how would I give feedback while testing ? here? re: torbirdy

Yes.

mT8RQf:

so for qubes user there is NO whonix “call for testing” at present?

There is none but there are quite a few users for upgraded Qubes-Whonix 13 to Qubes-Whonix 14 testers-only as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Upgrading_Whonix_13_to_Whonix_14. I will write one now to make it official.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.6.8 Release Candidate - Testers Wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
mT8RQf:

if it is going to be released as stable, is there still a need to install this on VB as a ‘tester’> let’s say I install it, how does that help the Whonix team, is there
a places to report errors or ?

If you’re generally Qubes user, wait for Qubes-Whonix call for testers.

Whonix

Upgrading Whonix 13 to Whonix 14

How to Upgrade from Whonix 13.x to Whonix 14.x

I guess I need to update my qubes 3.2 debian template to debian 9

Whonix doesn’t require that. Unrelated.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.6.8 Release Candidate - Testers Wanted!

item.title: Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.6.8 Release Candidate - Testers Wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
mT8RQf:

forgive me , but where in the whonix website does it indicate what the current stable version of whonix is ?

See:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Portal

Latest stable release

Generally:

Whonix

Stay Tuned

Stay up-to-date on the latest Whonix news

and/or in Q3.2 what version I am currently using ?

This is a question to ask Qubes support.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.6.8 Release Candidate - Testers Wanted!
item.dc:creator: unman
item.description:
Shared folders work fine on the new install.
On an upgrade from 13, I had some problems with “GuestAdditions not installed”, and had to reinstall them - afterwards, shared folders and all Guest Additions worked fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.6.8 Release Candidate - Testers Wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Still need at least one more release because I forgot about this one:

Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.5.5 Testers Wanted! Development
Icons are missing on the desktop. They are in the /home/user/Desktop folder, however. This got lost somewhere between 13 and 14. When the initramfs gets updated due to whatever reason (like new kernel, grub-live, manually running update-initramfs -u -k all) you get an additional boot delay of ~30 sec where it runs some scripts/local-block. This is a known issue: https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=860533 RESUME=none has to be added either to /etc/initramfs-tools/initramfs.conf o…

HulaHoop:

Whonix KVM Looking good. Can be released tomorrow if you want.

Great!

  • Is coyim not included because you decided to freeze packages?

Yes.

  • Are there alternative taskbar icons that don’t need compositor support?

Could you please post this issue in the sdwdate-gui thread (if that is
what you are referring to)? iry and troudabour would know better.

  • I want to reinstate acpi (for timesync lockdown support) and the clflush instruction (for Java x64 compatibility) Should I do this now or by Whonix 15?

These changes are contained to whonix-libvirt package? Can be done
before Whonix 15.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.6.8 Release Candidate - Testers Wanted!

item.title: Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.6.8 Release Candidate - Testers Wanted!
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Whonix KVM Looking good. Can be released tomorrow if you want.

Questions:

  • Is coyim not included because you decided to freeze packages?

  • Are there alternative taskbar icons that don’t need compositor support? Although I don’t mind it some people might think there is something broken.

  • I want to reinstate acpi (for timesync lockdown support) and the clflush instruction (for Java x64 compatibility) Should I do this now or by Whonix 15?

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.6.8 Release Candidate - Testers Wanted!

item.title: Whonix VirtualBox 14.0.0.6.8 Release Candidate - Testers Wanted!

item.description:
Hi. This is caused by disabling the KDE compositor. We did this to decrease RAM use.
